title: What People Actually Watch on Netflix, SCOTUS OKs Slavery 6.28.21
itunes:title: What People Actually Watch on Netflix, SCOTUS OKs Slavery 6.28.21
description:
In episode 939, Jack and guest host Jacquis Neal are joined by Left Handed Radio's Adam Bozarth to discuss the building collapsing in Miami, the Supreme Court blocking a child slavery lawsuit, Nielsen ratings coming to streaming, and more!

FOOTNOTES:

  1. Collapsed Miami condo had been sinking into Earth as early as the 1990s, researchers say
  2. U.S. Supreme Court rules for Nestle, Cargill over slavery lawsuit
  3. US Supreme Court blocks child slavery lawsuit against chocolate firms
  4. Supreme Court Rules Against Union Recruiting on California Farms
  5. Nielsen Now Knows When You Are Streaming
  6. Nielsen History Goes Back Further than You Think
  7. How Nielsen Has Built a TV Ratings Monopoly Nearly as Old as TV
  8. What Are Nielsen Ratings And How Are They Calculated?
  9. Nielsen Plays Catch-Up as Streaming Era Wreaks Havoc on TV Raters
  10. Nielsen Rejects Demand From Major Networks for Coronavirus Ratings Audit
  11. Nielsen Likely Undercounted Some Pandemic Audiences, Media Review Finds
  12. Nielsen Now Knows When You Are Streaming
  13. Nielsen takes another crack at gauging our streaming habits
  14. ‘The Handmaid’s Tale’ Shoots to the Top of Nielsen’s Streaming Ratings
  15. #Lucifer and #ArmyOfTheDead Top This Weeks Nielsen Top 20 Streaming Chart - 24th June 2021
  16. Nielsen Streaming Ratings: Netflix’s ‘Lucifer’ Has SVOD’s Biggest Week* Since ‘Coming 2 America’ Debuted in Early-March
  17. LISTEN: Rex Orange County - Loving is Easy (feat. Benny Sings)

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.
